page.title: 14Housing renovations in Water
page.content: The area has numerous old farmhouses of which many had, with the change in farming styles, fallen into disrepair. When the motorway(M66) opened to Rawtenstall the area became more accessible to Manchester. Property was cheap by comparison, but needed bringing up to date. There are two groups of properties being renovated a) terraced houses and b)detached farmhouses - these are being updated at great cost to provide large comfortable houses for business and professional people. Many of the old characteristics, such as timber beams and stone mullion windows are being retained, the latter double glazed. All receive central heating and modern fittings and conveniences. Woodburning stoves in some take advantage of large, local timber supplies.
